questions.text: A clinician touched the eyes of a patient with a piece of cotton, and rapid blinking of eyes occurred in response. What is the structure responsible for carrying the above sensation?
After a roller coaster ride, a person experiences a brief sense of imbalance before standing upright. Which tract helps maintain balance in this situation?
The lymph nodes located at the site indicated by the arrow are classified under which level?
A patient presents with a hypopigmented patch behind the ear with loss of sensation. Neck examination reveals a thickened structure, as shown in the image below. What is this structure?
A primigravida woman gives birth to a baby with the following defect. Identify the anomaly.
A 1-month-old baby is diagnosed with ventricular septal defect (VSD) and patent ductus arteriosus (PDA). The VSD is caused by ?

options.label: A
options.text: Improper fusion of both the membranous and muscular portions of the interventricular septum

options.label: B
options.text: Improper fusion of the membranous portion of the interventricular septum

options.label: C
options.text: Improper development of the muscular portion of the interventricular septum

options.label: D
options.text: Improper fusion of the endocardial cushions

questions.correct_answer: A. Improper fusion of both the membranous and muscular portions of the interventricular septum

questions.text: Which of the following muscles will be paralyzed if there is an injury to the nucleus underlying the marked structure?
Identify the structure in the given image.
Which segment of the nephron has the lowest osmolality in the absence of the ADH hormone?

options.label: D
options.text: Descending Limb of the Loop of Henle

questions.text: Which of the following cells is responsible for the removal of small foreign particles trapped in the lungs?
In the Jugular Venous Pressure waveform what does the “a” wave correspond to?

options.label: C
options.text: Ttricuspid valve bulging into right atria

questions.text: In a patient, after administration of Noradrenaline injection, the heart rate started to decrease. What is the reason behind it?
A person is performing weightlifting and attempts to lift the dumbbells overhead. Which of the following changes will be seen in the sarcomere during this process?
A postmenopausal lady with osteoporosis is advised to remain upright for at least half an hour after administration of her medication. What side effect is being prevented by doing this?

A 35-year-old man arrives at the emergency room with breathing difficulty and cyanosis after inhaling phosphine gas while working on a car in a garage. Despite being given pure oxygen, his oxygen levels stay low and do not improve. What type of hypoxia is most likely causing his symptoms?
Which one of the following is related to the release of bicarbonate in exchange for chloride in the RBC to maintain electrical neutrality?

Dehydration occurs in both adults and children, but children become dehydrated more easily than adults. How does the ratio of extracellular fluid (ECF) to intracellular fluid (ICF) in children differ from that in adults?
questions.correct_answer: C. ECF is higher than ICF

questions.text: A renal biopsy of a patient is shown below. Identify the cells marked in the given histological image.
The image shows the oxygen-haemoglobin dissociation curve plotted during different conditions. Which among the following conditions would result in curve D?
Which of the following hormone is responsible for the following natural process?
Which vitamin deficiency is associated with a chronic alcoholic patient presenting with gum bleeding, corkscrew hair, petechial haemorrhages, poor wound healing, and generalized weakness?

A firefighter sustains electrical burns while at work. On arrival at the ED, he is hemodynamically stable. ECG monitoring and initial fluid resuscitation are started. His urine is collected for routine lab examination and appears as below. Which of the following is most likely to be found on urine analysis?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased RBC metabolites in the urine

questions.text: A 4-day-old neonate presented with jaundice and a bilirubin level of 5 mg/dL. The most probable cause is?
A patient presents with arthritis, and during arthroscopy, ochronosis is noted. The ferric chloride test is positive. Which of the following enzyme deficiency is responsible for this condition?
Which of the following substances is excreted in the urine of a patient with essential pentosuria?
A baby presents with chronic diarrhea and rashes on the genital region, as shown below. What is the most likely deficiency associated with this condition?
A chronic alcoholic patient with a reduced food intake over the past few months now presents with hypoglycemia. What is the most likely cause of hypoglycemia in this case?
Which hormone is primarily produced during starvation to regulate and maintain blood glucose levels?
The RNA molecule contains the coding sequence AACACCACAC. What will be the corresponding DNA sequence from which it was transcribed?
Which enzyme is responsible for the removal of triglycerides from chylomicron?
A 25-year-old male with malaria and family history of hemolytic anemia should have what test before starting antimalarials?
A patient presented with a cold and cough. He tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 virus. What test is done to confirm the diagnosis?
Which of the following best describes the control of enzyme activity by phosphorylation or dephosphorylation?
Which of the following amino acids primarily acts as a buffer in blood due to its ability to accept and donate protons at physiological pH?
Which of the following enzymes are affected during the process of collagen synthesis due to vitamin C deficiency?
In the case of prolonged starvation, acetyl-CoA is mostly used for ?

A 31-year-old female presents with fatigue, paleness, and dizziness. Laboratory tests reveal low serum iron levels. Given these findings and her negative iron balance, what changes in iron metabolism would be expected in this patient?
questions.correct_answer: C. Increased Total Iron Binding Capacity (TIBC)

questions.text: A 3-year-old child presents with epiphora and probing reveals a soft block at 7 mm. What is the best treatment option for this condition?
A patient with a history of diabetes presents with cataract. Which of the following metabolic products is primarily responsible for cataract formation?
The cover-uncover test is performed to diagnose various eye conditions. Which of the following is not detected by this test?
Which of the following statements is correct regarding indirect ophthalmoscopy?

options.label: A
options.text: The image produced is erect and real

options.label: C
options.text: Condensor needs to be kept very close to the eye

questions.text: A patient sustained blunt trauma to the eye 6 months ago and now presents with double vision. What is the most likely condition?
A patient presents with right-sided visual field defects in both eyes while central vision remains unaffected. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.correct_answer: D. Homonymous hemianopia with macular sparing

questions.text: A newborn baby brought by the mother with complaints of the left upper eyelid moving up and down during breastfeeding or thumb sucking which disappears when the baby is not being fed. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A child presents with eyelid crusting and a gritty sensation between the eyelashes. He also has difficulty in opening eyelids. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the accommodative amplitude of a patient with a near point at 20 cm and a far point at infinity?

A 6-year-old girl came to your clinic with refractive power of +1D in right eye and -2D in left eye. Fundus examination reveals normal acuity and retinal findings. What is the correct diagnosis? D-dioptre
What is the recommended maximum time frame for cornea harvesting after death to ensure optimal transplant quality?
A patient has a history of a flying foreign body injury to the eye. After 8 weeks, heterochromia iridis is noted. Which of the following substances is most likely involved in the deposition?
A patient presents with vision problems and has a history of cataract surgery. OCT findings are given. What is the syndrome associated with these findings? OCT-Optical coherence tomography

A patient with CSOM presented to the OPD with seizures, headache, vomiting and photophobia. On eye examination, homonymous hemianopia was noted. CT brain showed the following findings. Identify the condition.

A 49-year-old female from Nagaland presented with right-sided hearing loss. On examination, a dull right tympanic membrane is noted. Enlarged lymph nodes are seen in the posterior triangle of the neck. Which of the following is the management of this condition?
A young boxer receives a blow near the eye during a boxing match. He presents to the ER with hematoma around eye, CT scan is shown below. Identify the radiological sign shown below?

A child was eating a custard apple when a seed suddenly became lodged in the throat, causing coughing and respiratory distress. On palpation, a knob-like structure was felt, and auscultation revealed an audible thud. What is the likely location of the obstruction?
A patient presents with nasal obstruction and merciful anosmia. Greenish-black crusts were found in the nasal cavity of a patient. What is the likely diagnosis?
Identify the type of tympanoplasty shown in the image below.
A 50-year-old man presented with difficulty in hearing. A pure-tone audiogram was obtained, which is shown below. What is the interpretation of this audiogram?
The following sign is seen in a patient presenting with rhinorrhea following a skull base fracture. Identify the sign.
What is the important area depicted in the given image by red arrow?
Which of the following conditions shown in the given CT is associated with the Holman-Miller sign?

A patient presented with nasal congestion and upon examination, nasal polyps were observed. A coronal CT scan finding of the patient is given below. Which of the following sinus drainage pathways is likely to be affected? CT-Computed Tomography
Identify the structure marked in the image below.
A 2-year-old child was eating peanuts when he suddenly developed respiratory distress, cough, and was unable to speak. What is the initial treatment for this condition?
A child presents with the findings shown in the image below. Which structure is most likely involved in this condition?

A patient diagnosed with tuberculosis and HIV was started on both anti-tubercular therapy (ATT) and antiretroviral therapy (ART). After 2 months, the patient experienced a deterioration in his health. What is the most likely cause?

options.label: A
options.text: Drug-drug interaction between TB and HIV medications

options.label: B
options.text: Development of drug resistance to anti-tubercular drugs

options.label: D
options.text: Development of drug resistance to ART

questions.correct_answer: C. Immunological changes in the body

questions.text: An HIV-positive man presents with a high-grade fever. Examination reveals a positive Kernig’s sign. CSF shows reduced glucose, increased protein, and increased leukocytes. A diagnosis of cryptococcal meningitis is made. What is the appropriate management for this patient?

A patient visits the neurology clinic with trouble transitioning between movements and exhibits involuntary hand movements during rapid alternating tasks, such as finger tapping. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A patient with liver cirrhosis presents with breathing difficulty due to massive ascites. Which is an incorrect statement about this case?

options.label: A
options.text: Serum albumin ascites gradient of greater than 1.1 g/dL

options.label: B
options.text: Serum albumin ascites gradient of less than 1.1 g/dL

options.label: C
options.text: Ascitic protein level less than 2.5 g/dL suggests damage to hepatic sinusoids

questions.correct_answer: B. Serum albumin ascites gradient of less than 1.1 g/dL

questions.text: A young male presents with left-sided facial weakness. On examination, the patient is able to wrinkle his forehead and is able to close the right eye partially, and his mouth deviates towards the right side when smiling. Based on these findings, which of the following statements best describes the type and location of the lesion?

options.label: A
options.text: Supranuclear facial palsy on the left side

options.label: B
options.text: Infranuclear facial palsy on the left side

options.label: C
options.text: Supranuclear facial palsy on the right side

options.label: D
options.text: Infranuclear facial palsy on the right side

questions.correct_answer: D. Infranuclear facial palsy on the right side

questions.text: The patient presents with headache, vomiting and nuchal rigidity. Guarded LP was done and shows turbid CSF. Microscopy shows 90% PMN cells with sugar of 40 mg/dL and protein of 200 mg/dl. Which is correct about the management of this case?
A patient has been diagnosed with mitral stenosis. What is the determinant of the severity of mitral stenosis?
A boy comes with the history of passing of black urine during the night time, and on further investigation, CD55 and CD59 markers were negative. Which condition is the boy most likely suffering from?
A 6-month-old child is noted to have muscle weakness. Vitals Pulse: 80/min, BP 70/50 mm Hg. The workup shows metabolic alkalosis with hypokalaemia and hypomagnesemia. What is the likely diagnosis?
The INR ratio recommended for the administration of warfarin in patients with mechanical heart valves is

A patient with a history of Infect”on two weeks ago developed progressively ascending, bilaterally symmetric flaccid weakness in the lower limbs, which later involved the upper limbs. Examination reveals absent spinal cord reflexes. Based on the given findings, what could be the likely diagnosis?
A patient has visual disturbance a”d pain abdomen after drinking from a local shop. Which metabolite is responsible for that?
A patient came to the hospital with complaints of breathlessness and is diagnosed with a Pancoast tumor. Which of the following findings is not typically associated with this condition?
A 5-year-old child with anasarca is found to have proteinuria >4g/day, oedema and hypoalbuminemia, which is consistent with nephrotic syndrome. What is the recommended management for this patient?
A patient with a history of pneumonia develops pleural effusion. What is the expected finding in the pleural fluid analysis for parapneumonic effusion?

options.label: A
options.text: Pleural protein ratio less than 0.5 of serum protein

options.label: B
options.text: Pleural LDH less than 2/3rd of serum LDH

options.label: D
options.text: Pleural LDH less than 0.6 of serum LDH

questions.text: What is correct about first-degree heart block?

options.label: A
options.text: Normal PR and prolonged RR interval

options.label: B
options.text: Prolonged PR and normal RR interval

options.label: D
options.text: Short PR and normal RR interval

questions.correct_answer: B. Prolonged PR and normal RR interval

questions.text: Graham Steell murmur is heard in

An obese patient presented with pain in the right hypochondrium. He has a history of unhealthy food consumption. On examination, the liver was palpable below the costal margin. On USG, grade 2 fatty liver was diagnosed. What will be the initial management for this patient?
questions.correct_answer: B. Reduce weight and lifestyle changes

questions.text: A child with short stature and developmental delay comes to your clinic. On investigation, low calcium, high phosphate and very high PTH are found. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis? PTH-Parathyroid hormone

A 45-year-old patient who suffers from prinzmetal angina requires a formulation of nitroglycerine which has the most rapid onset of action. Which of the following formulations of nitroglycerin can be administered to the patient?

A 52-year-old woman complains of fatigue, dry skin and cold intolerance since 2 weeks. She was started on amiodarone 1 month ago for persistent atrial fibrillation. Tests show high TSH (15 mU/I) and low free T4 levels. How would you manage this patient?
Which of the following statements is correct regarding intrinsic acute kidney injury?
Chvostek’s sign is seen in?

The patient is admitted with low urine output, and lab reports show BUN: 140 mg/dL, serum creatinine: 8.0 mg/dL, and 2+ protein on urine dipstick. Which of the following is most useful for distinguishing acute kidney injury (AKI) from chronic kidney disease (CKD)?
A young female presents with vomiting episodes for the past few days. Interpret the ABG report of pH: 7.53, pCO2 48 mm Hg and HCO3: 33 meq/L.

A patient with diabetes mellitus has a fasting blood sugar of 180 mg/dL and HbA1c of 8.5%. The treatment was started on Tab metformin 500mg, and his blood sugar has come down to 140 mg/dL, but his HbA1c remains above 7.3%. What is the next step In management?”

options.label: B
options.text: Continue metformin at the same dose

questions.text: A patient present” with a unilateral throbbing headache in the temporal region and light sensitivity associated with photophobia, nausea and vomiting. She reports that each episode lasts for a maximum of 24 hours, which was relieved by giving triptans. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient presents with fatigue and chronic diarrhea for 4 months. Endoscopy reveals several ulcers in the gastric antrum and the descending duodenum. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 50-year-old patient presents with respiratory difficulty and a history of chronic smoking for the last 30 years. Pulmonary function testing shows a decrease in FEV1% and FEV1/FVC ratio. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A patient presents with progressive increase in shortness of breath. On examination, left parasternal heave is noted. On auscultation, a systolic murmur is heard. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 47-year-old hypertensive woman came to your clinic complaining of bone pain. She has a history of recurrent renal stones. Which of the following is the most appropriate management for this condition?

A 45-year-old chronic alcoholic man, after attending a party, was brought to the hospital by his relative with complaints of seeing snakes crawling in his room and inability to recognise his family members. He reports his last alcohol intake was 48 hours ago. What is the likely diagnosis?

A young lady presents with recent-onset palpitations and dizziness. Her ECG shows absent P waves and an irregularly irregular RR interval. Her pulse rate is 140 bpm and BP is 80/60 mmHg. Which of the following is the most appropriate management?

The patient came to the ER with pain on the left side of the chest radiating to the left arm and shoulder for the last 40 minutes. ECG shows ST depression in precordial leads. What is the next best step in management?
The patient came to the ER with pain on the left side of the chest radiating to the left arm and shoulder following exercise. The pain subsided after some time. What is the next step in management?

A 60-year-old man with a known case of rheumatic heart disease presents with SOB. On examination, hyperdynamic precordium is noted with a water hammer pulse, and a pistol shot sound over femoral arteries is heard. Auscultation shows pan systolic murmur and early diastolic murmur. Which is the predominant valvular lesion shown below?
A 4-month-old child was brought to the hospital with an abdominal lesion, as shown in the image. What is the appropriate management for this condition?
A 30-year-old female presents with painful genital ulcers on vulva accompanied by bilateral lymphadenopathy. She has a history of multiple partners over the years. What is the diagnosis?
A 50-year-old lady diagnosed with breast carcinoma. Who underwent chemotherapy presents with hair loss after 3 weeks. What is this pattern of hair loss known as?
The given picture shows lesions found on the glans penis and pigmentation in the chin and oral cavity. What is the diagnosis?
A patient presents with multiple nodulocystic lesions on the face. Which among the following is the drug of choice in this condition?
A 30-year-old male presents with following finding. Which of the following clinical tests will aid in diagnosis?
A non-smoker patient with a history of cardiac disease suddenly develops chest pain and breathlessness. An X-ray is performed and given below. What is the likely diagnosis?

A patient presents with backache, night sweats, an evening increase in temperature, and unintentional weight loss. Laboratory tests reveal an increase in CRP and ESR levels. An MRI is provided below. What is the diagnosis?
Which of the following is the primary use of the given imaging modality?

A 64-year-old man is rushed to the emergency department with severe abdominal pain, abdominal distension, and obstipation. His erect X-ray abdomen is as shown. Which of the following is the likely diagnosis?
A female patient presents with difficulty ingesting liquids more than solids. What is the most likely characteristic finding on imaging?

A patient with a history of breast cancer underwent tele cobalt-60 radiotherapy. She now presents with respiratory distress, and imaging shows bilateral perihilar ground glass opacities. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following dosage regimens for the adult leprosy treatment kit is incorrect?
National Deworming Day is observed on
The government pasted public awareness posters in public places. What type of communication method does this approach represent?
Which of the following vaccines is contraindicated in pregnancy?
According to the latest 2024 updates in NIS, what are the correct fractional doses of IPV vaccines?
What is it called when a tour guide leads a group of tourists as they follow him through various attractions?
A handwashing awareness session was conducted in a community. The correct sequence of events here is:

A group of 400 low birth weight (LBW) babies and 200 normal birth weight babies were monitored from birth until one year of age to assess the development of protein-energy malnutrition, with data collected at regular intervals throughout the study. What type of study does this represent?
What is the particle size of dust particles involved in pneumoconiosis?

Mr. X enlisted in the Navy in 1997, married Y in 1999, and welcomed their first child, V, in 2002, followed by their second child, M, in 2009. After retiring in 2020 and starting a job at SBI, his parents moved in to live with his family. Which of the following statements accurately describes this family?
Which ministry is the main authority for disaster management in India?

options.label: D
options.text: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

questions.text: Which of the following is correct about the management of HIV patient with multiple dog bites?
questions.correct_answer: B. Rabies vaccine + immunoglobuin+ wound management

questions.text: An HIV patient presented with bouts of cough and fever. What is the selective medium used for investigation?
A Tzanck smear prepared from a vesicle sample revealed multinucleated giant cells. What is the most likely causative agent?
A group of 20 students in a hostel had fried rice as dinner. 6 hours later, they all experienced severe vomiting. Which of the following organisms is most likely responsible?
A patient got pricked by a rose thorn and presents with multiple vesicles on hand and multiple eruptions along the lymphatics. What is the most likely causative agent?

A firefighter presents with fever, cough, and lung consolidation. Microbiological testing reveals a gram-negative, oxidase-positive organism. The culture shows colonies that show a property of transillumination when light is passed. What is the most likely causative agent?

A 42-year-old HIV patient presented with altered sensorium and impaired consciousness. India Ink examination shows positive results. Which organism is most likely to be responsible for this condition?
What is the mechanism of action of botulinum toxin?
A patient's laboratory result is positive for typhoid and Widal test findings are given below. What is the most appropriate stage of this disease? O Ag>1:20 H Ag >1:380 A Ag>1:20 B Ag >1:20
Which organism has the following cell wall structure?

A 4-year-old boy develops bloody diarrhea and abdominal cramps. The bacteria isolated from the stool specimen fermented lactose and produced colorless colonies on sorbitol MacConkey agar. The most likely etiological agent in this case is?
A farmer working in a paddy field presented with fever, muscle pain, nausea and vomiting. The microscopic agglutination test was positive. What is the diagnosis?

A 70-year-old patient presented with a fever persisting for 3 weeks. He gives a history of prosthetic valve implantation 6 months before. Investigations reveal mitral valve vegetation and is diagnosed with endocarditis. Which of the following is the most common cause of endocarditis in this patient?

A 9-month-old child is admitted to the ICU with a history of recurrent sinusitis and otitis media caused by Staphylococcus aureus. Lab results shows low levels of Immunoglobulins (G,A,M,E) and low quantity of plasma B cells. There is a normal reaction to environmental antigens on the skin. What is the most likely diagnosis?
For the diagnosis of Rickettsia, an antigen of Proteus is used. What is this type of antigen called?
A baby is born with sensory neural deafness, patent ductus arteriosus (PDA), and salt pepper appearance on retinoscopy. Identify the infection in the mother.
A patient presents with non-pulsatile proptosis that increases when bending down. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 10-year-old boy fell and injured his arm. Upon examination, a brownish-black scab is observed. What is the estimated time of injury?

A boy is severely beaten by 4 to 5 people and arrives at the hospital with serious injuries. A dying declaration is recorded. Which of the following statements about dying declarations in India is false?

options.label: B
options.text: It must always be recorded by a Magistrate

options.label: D
options.text: An oath is not administered before recording a dying declaration.

questions.correct_answer: B. It must always be recorded by a Magistrate

questions.text: Magistrate’s inquest is done in:

options.label: D
options.text: When the family wants to reconduct the inquest

questions.correct_answer: A. Death due to police firing

questions.text: A person was stabbed In the thigh with a knife, resulting in a wound measuring 1 cm in length and 3 cm in depth. How would you classify this wound?

During the court proceedings, the defense lawyer asks a leading question, which the prosecutor appeals against. The judge grants the appeal. Such questions are permitted during which of the following?

A doctor received a summons from the criminal court to provide evidence as an expert witness, but two days earlier, he had also received a summons from the civil court. What should the doctor do in this situation?

options.label: A
options.text: Attend the summons for the criminal case

options.label: B
options.text: Attend the summons in the civil court

options.label: C
options.text: Attend the court for the summons received first and inform the other court accordingly.

options.label: D
options.text: Inform both the courts and wait

questions.correct_answer: A. Attend the summons for the criminal case

questions.text: A body brought for autopsy was cold and had developed rigor mortis in all 4 limbs and livor mortis at the back, there is no sign of putrefaction. What is the estimated time since death?
A female died due to an unnatural cause within 7 years of marriage, and allegations have been raised. Under which section will the inquest be conducted? BNS- Bhartiya Nyaya Sanhita
Two construction workers were working together when a hammer slipped from one worker’s hand and struck the other on the head. An X-ray revealed a fracture. What type of fracture could this be?
During a forensic examination, the police presented a skull bone for analysis, and the cephalic index was determined to be 85. Which race does the skull likely belong to?
